dt: {bc}to introduce or insert surreptitiously or without warrant
{bc}to force another to accept especially by stealth or deceit

dt.t: when the states … {wi}foist{/wi} unnecessary expenses on local taxpayers

dt: {bc}to pass off as genuine or worthy

dt.t: {wi}foist{/wi} costly and valueless products on the public
… inferior caviar has been {wi}foisted{/wi} on an unknowing public …

et: probably from obsolete Dutch {it}vuisten{/it} to take into one's hand, from Middle Dutch {it}vuysten{/it}, from {it}vuyst{/it} fist; akin to Old English {it}fȳst{/it} fist
shortdef: to introduce or insert surreptitiously or without warrant
to force another to accept especially by stealth or deceit
to pass off as genuine or worthy
